questionTitle: When a mobile user is connected to the mobile service, how many sets of information is exchanged?
questionExplanation: Two different sets of information is exchanged between user and mobile-logical and physical context.

questionOption1: Each mobile device contains and is capable of transmitting a large amount of information concerning the condition or state of the device and the user who carries the device
questionOption2: Location is the prime example of context
questionOption3: When we search for something near us, the search engine returns results that are independent of location
questionExplanation: When parsed properly, this information can provide intelligent systems with not only the user’s identification but the context in which that user finds himself.

questionTitle: Which of the following context contains information derived from measurements made from the mobile device or its sensors?
questionExplanation: Physical context provides location, ambient device conditions, device states, and more.

questionTitle: Which of the following context contains information derived from the user or from the manner in which the user has interacted with services over time?
questionExplanation: Logical contexts are information about the purpose a location serves, a digital identity and its associated attributes, relationships, interests, past searches, Web sites visited, privileges, and preferences.

questionOption1: When a phone transmits its GPS coordinates to a service, that service may be able to compare that location to the customer’s registered home address
questionOption2: Only one mechanisms exist for aggregating WSDL documents into a searchable form
questionOption3: AJAX is an OASIS standard that is searchable and is in the JSON format
questionExplanation: This will send information appropriate to each environment back to the user.

questionTitle: Which of the following provides a set of methods for using modules to construct loosely coupled complex systems from standard parts?
questionExplanation: Method of construction of the modules is abstracted out of the system and encapsulated in SOA.

questionTitle: What is the role played by Web service in SOA?
questionExplanation: SOA requires a standard messaging protocol and a form of federated database system.

questionTitle: Which of the following plays the role of the orchestrator providing programmed logic that works with the data parsed by the Context Parser?
questionExplanation: The Context Parser takes all the input data (digital signals in many cases) and applies a logical schema to create the needed structured objects for the Logic Processor’s use.

questionTitle: The specific ontology that applies to a mobile SOA is ______________
questionExplanation: WOL stands for Web Ontology Language.

questionTitle: The concept of creating a structured representation of concepts and their relationship in a domain is referred to as ________
questionExplanation: Ontology is a formal way of specifying a shared abstraction.
